title: FT readers' best books of 2021
text:
As always, we had some wonderful responses from book-loving FT readers across the globe. Here are your best suggestions — from John le Carré's swansong and a more holistic approach to treating pandemics, to the story of JP Morgan's personal librarian who “passed” as white, and a moving novel of lost identity and poverty in the aftermath of the Algerian war of independence.

Source: 2021 'FT readers' best books of 2021' FT.com 19 November. Used under licence from the Financial Times. © The Financial Times Limited 2021. All Rights Reserved.
